mods.note: Dhahran, Saudi Arabia, August 8, 1946. Lt. Colonel A. C. Galloway, Political Agent, Bahrein Islands. My dear Galloway, This Consulate has. just received the enclosed notice concerning the Direction Finder at Baghdad Airport which we are forwarding to you for your information. We have no knowledge as to whether this facility is at present still unserviceable. Very truly yours, (P 1. Copy of notice.© American Legation, Baghdad, Iraq July 19,1946. Following 'Notice to Airmen” issued by Directorate of Civil Aviation on May 27, received today: 'It is hereby notified that the Bellini Tossi Direction Finder at Baghdad Airport has been declared unserviceable. 'All pilots flying in this vicinity should be warned that this facility no longer exists, and that direction finding at Baghdad Airport will not be available until further notice.' LI

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a letter from Parker Thompson Hart, American Consul at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia, enclosing a copy of a letter received from the American Legation at Baghdad. The letter reports that the Directorate of Civil Aviation has issued a "Notice to Airmen" that the Bellini Tossi Direction Finder at Baghdad Airport has been declared unserviceable.There are internal office notes on folio 5.
